intro: Ecbolium desertorum, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has adapted to extreme desert conditions through features such as deep root systems and reduced leaf surface area. Its blooms typically appear in spring, providing a brief but striking display in the desert landscape. Ecbolium desertorum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
